question.body: According to a study published by the National Institute of Health, during intercourse condom breakage rates fall between 0.4% and 2.3%. Suppose that the breakage rate of Brand X is 2%. A Brand X Pleasure Pack contains 12 condoms. What is the probability that at least one of the condoms in the pack will break during intercourse?

response.feedback: Incorrect. 0.02 is the probability that a condom will break. But you need to consider all 12 condoms to find the probability that at least one will break out of the 12.

Incorrect. You may have calculated the probability that exactly one condom in the pack breaks, which is (0.02)(0.98) ^ 11. You need to find the probability that AT LEAST one condom in the pack breaks.
Correct. P(at least one breaks) = 1 âˆ’ P(none break) = 1 - (0.98) ^ 12 = 0.215
